intro: Botrycarpum obtusilobum, commonly known as the broad-lobed buttercup, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its basal leaves with broad, rounded lobes and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short stem and produces achenes as its fruit, which are dispersed by wind. Botrycarpum obtusilobum is native to parts of Asia and is often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates.
